paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel KCNH2 variant associated with long QT syndrome and fetal heart block.

patients.phenotype: long QT syndrome with high-degree atrioventricular block

individual_records.phenotype_details: long QT syndrome, high-degree AV block, transient ventricular tachycardia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Following birth, the neonate was confirmed to have a significantly prolonged QTc interval with high-degree AVB (2:1 transduction).

functional_data.summary: Functional validation experiments demonstrated prolonged duration of calcium transit both in depolarization and repolarization with the KCNH2 c.1868C>A variant.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was de novo; neither parent carried the KCNH2 c.1868C>A variant.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in 1000G and ExAC databases.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and de novo occurrence.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of the KCNH2 c.1868C>A variant.
key_quotes: A novel KCNH2 variant related to LQTS and associated with high-degree fetal AVB.
The variant we identified, KCNH2 c.1868C>A, had not been reported in any population.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
